question: Which state government has launched India's first post office passport service center?
explanation: The Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has inaugurated Indiaâ€™s first post office passport service centre at the Vidisha Post Office in Vidisha on February 25, 2017. The passport service centre will work in the form of Passport Sewa Laghu Kendra (PSLK). The centre will complete scrutiny and approval of passport applications in a day and provide passport to applicants in three days.
